channel.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New
channel.description: I made a couple Artmoney tutorials a long time ago, and I was just going through my old HD and found all my tuts, so im going to be posting them all here, hope they help you!

item.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Yea, artmoney is funny, I tricked me mate on a level 3 account lol. he was like “WTF??!?!?!?!?!?!!?” I was like “^.^”

Read full topic

item.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New

wow that was not the right time to make a typo :P[/quote]
Well everyone makes mistakes

Read full topic

item.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

client side*
wow that was not the right time to make a typo

yea youre right. the server recognizes you screwed with the values, and it changes it back. thats why in runescape (ive heard) the first trade screen says like 1M for red Party hat, then the second trade screen says 50gp-red party hat.

Read full topic

item.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New
item.dc:creator: @Omfgurweird Omfgurweird
item.description:
@Omfgurweird wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:8, topic:5341”]its not fake idiots. Its a real memory editor, its just that it is server side and when you try to make a bank deposite or a trade in runescape, it is viewed and it just thinks there is an error. Then the money is set back to what it was before you changed it.
artmoney works in crappy games where they dont check anything you send to the server, like Adventure Quest

and theres really no point in posting tutorials for individual games and such. One only needs to know what to look for, and they can figure the rest out themselves.[/quote]
Isn’t it client side? I may be wrong but I was just curious. Because if it was server side, then it would be real? The reason its fake is because it only edits the memory obtained by the client, but if it tries to send it back to the server, it recognizes this modification and fixes it. Correct me if i’m wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Artmoney Tutorials - Old & New
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

its not fake idiots. Its a real memory editor, its just that it is *client side and when you try to make a bank deposite or a trade in runescape, it is viewed and it just thinks there is an error. Then the money is set back to what it was before you changed it.
artmoney works in crappy games where they dont check anything you send to the server, like Adventure Quest

and theres really no point in posting tutorials for individual games and such. One only needs to know what to look for, and they can figure the rest out themselves.

Read full topic
